result.execSummary:
The defendant Genevieve Salvinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 3:04 p.m. Defendant Genevieve Salvinski in court with attorney John J Hogan.  Defendant Genevieve Salvinski in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hogan statement that compromised agreement of $96,000 balance of restitution has been reached. Defendant agrees to stipulated amount. Court questions defendant as to possible life insurance with victims as beneficiaries. Hogan states defendant has no money for premium. Clerk to amend JOC to reflect stipulated amount of restitution. Adj. 3:09 p.m.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
3:27 p.m. Defendant Genevieve Salvinski in court with attorney John J Hogan.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend to theft under $10,000- Class I felony - Granted. Hogan has dropped off check in amount of $45,000 to DA's trust account for partial payment of restitution. Schiek statement that they need to verify funds - Schiek/Hogan statement to amount of restitution - Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Hogan/Court statement on sentencing. Sentencing is contingent upon $45,000 check clearing.
Court Statement
WHS/POP - 3 years
Restitution - to be determined
Jail - 90 days with Huber for all purposes to commence on/before January 29, 2016 at 8:00 a.m. - may be served in Oneida or Vilas County
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Probation to be extended until restitution is paid in full.
Appeal rights given. Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment given.
Adj. 4:00 pm  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Genevieve Salvinski in court with attorney John J Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:09
Hogan statement to status- agreement reached- defendant to be getting restitution to be paid up front - will be available this Friday -=  request adj
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

11:01 a.m. Defendant Genevieve Salvinski in court with attorney John J Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hogan states agreement has been reached; need extra time to arrange for funds for restitution - requests adjournment for approximately 6 weeks. Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
